title: Humza Yousaf to Stand for Leader of SNP After Sturgeon Quits
description: Scottish Health Secretary Humza Yousaf announced his bid to become leader of the Scottish National Party and first minister after Nicola Sturgeon unexpectedly quit on Wednesday.

title: Blinken Says US Concerned China Is Weighing Lethal Aid to Russia
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken said the US has information that China is considering whether to supply Russia weapons and ammunition for the invasion of Ukraine.

title: Jimmy Carter to Receive Hospice Care After Recent Hospital Stays
description: Former President Jimmy Carter is receiving hospice care at home, his foundation said Saturday.

title: US, China Top Diplomats Hold First Meeting After Balloon Crisis
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken sat down with China’s top diplomat Wang Yi on Saturday in the first in-person meeting between the two nations since an uproar over an alleged spy balloon dramatically worsened US-China ties.

title: Dutch Expel 10 Russian Diplomats, Shut St. Petersburg Consulate
description: The Dutch government ordered about 10 Russian diplomats to leave the country, saying Moscow has been using diplomatic cover for espionage.

title: Azeri President Blames Iran’s ‘Establishment’ for Embassy Attack
description: Azerbaijan’s President Ilham Aliyev said the “Iranian establishment” was behind an armed attack on his country’s embassy in Tehran last month in which a security officer was killed and two others wounded.

title: Marianne Williamson Teases Long-Shot 2024 Challenge to Biden
description: Marianne Williamson, a best-selling self-help author, is throwing her hat in the US presidential race once again, this time facing slimmer odds than with her first attempt in 2020.

title: Bulgaria Detains 7 Over Deaths of 18 Migrants Found in Truck
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria (AP) — Authorities in Bulgaria have detained seven people in connection with an abandoned truck in which 18 people believed to be migrants were found dead, police said Saturday.

title: Cash Crisis Exposes Nigeria Ruling Party Schism Days Before Vote
description: Nigeria’s ruling party is divided over efforts to replace high-denomination banknotes, as many members who face elections in a week distance themselves from a policy backed by the president that’s disrupting life in Africa’s most populous country.

title: Europe Is Already Indirectly at War With Russia, Orban Says
description: Europe is indirectly at war with Russia because of its military support for Ukraine, Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban said Saturday in a speech addressing his refusal to send arms to Kyiv.

title: EU Urged to Sanction Moldova Oligarchs Linked to Unrest
description: Oligarchs accused of helping to destabilize Moldova and potentially overthrow its pro-European government should be targeted with European Union sanctions, Estonia’s top diplomat said.

title: Lack of Regulator Adds to White House Woes Over Ohio Derailment
description: President Joe Biden has yet to nominate someone to the lead the federal agency that regulates the transport of hazardous materials, including the toxic chemicals that spilled following the fiery derailment of a Norfolk Southern Corp. train in Ohio earlier this month.

title: Sunak Says NATO Should Agree to Ukraine Security Pledge by July
description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said NATO allies should finalize a security guarantee for Ukraine when the alliance’s leaders meet at a summit in July.

title: No End in Sight to Putin’s Invasion of Ukraine: Weekend Reads
description: Next week marks a year since Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered the invasion of Ukraine, igniting Europe’s largest conflict since World War II. Signs are that it’s going to be a long war.

title: DeSantis Is Trying to Turn Trump’s Biggest Win Into a Liability
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis is betting he can use one of Donald Trump's biggest successes to turn voters against the former president.

title: Five Million Carnival Goers Descend on Rio as Brazil Seeks Comeback
description: Rio de Janeiro will welcome an estimated five million revelers at its Carnival celebrations this weekend, signaling a comeback for Brazil after two years of Covid-19 put celebrations on hold.

title: Your Saturday UK Briefing: Sunak Goes to Munich With Northern Ireland Deal in Reach
description: Follow us at  @BloombergUK and on  Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter with Allegra Stratton.Rishi Sunak makes one of his first international outings as prime minister, traveling to the Munich Security Conference to tell the world that “now is the moment to double down on our military support for Ukraine.” That backing doesn’t seem to involve sending the advanced fighter jets that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy   pleaded for on a surprise trip to London last week.

title: Harris Says Russia Committed Crimes Against Humanity in Ukraine
description: Vice President Kamala Harris said the US has concluded that Russia committed “crimes against humanity” in its invasion of Ukraine and vowed that Moscow would be held to account for its actions.

title: China’s Balloon Fiasco May Accelerate US Decoupling
description: Despite Joe Biden’s promise Thursday to speak to Xi Jinping, the ship may have sailed in Washington when it comes to balloon diplomacy. Bipartisan furor over the alleged espionage platform that floated across the US heartland may give impetus to fresh economic penalties against China.

title: Finnish Premier Says She’s Still Dancing Despite the Criticism
description: Finnish Prime Minister Sanna Marin said she still lets her hair down when she’s off duty, despite the furor over a video of her partying last year.

title: Take Me Out to the Wind Turbines
description: Boat rides to offshore wind farms offer visitors an “otherworldly” opportunity to get up close.

title: Ukraine Latest: Harris Demands Justice for Russian ‘War Crimes’
description: US Vice President Kamala Harris accused Russian forces of committing war crimes in Ukraine and called on allies to back international tribunals convened to investigate any battlefield atrocities.

title: North Korea Fires Suspected Ballistic Missile Off East Coast
description: North Korea fired a suspected ballistic missile on Saturday, the Japan Cost Guard said, continuing to ratchet up tensions after a record number of launches in 2022.

title: China’s Top Diplomat Blasts US For ‘Hysterical’ Balloon Response
description: China’s top diplomat lashed out at the US, calling President Joe Biden’s decision to shoot a balloon over American air space and the heightened state of alert “near-hysterical behavior.”

title: China’s Baowu Seeks Deeper Ties with Rio Tinto on Iron Ore Trade
description: China Baowu Steel Group Corp., the world’s biggest steelmaker, will seek closer ties with iron ore miner Rio Tinto as China’s demand for the raw material rebounds.

title: Marcos Aims to Cool Tensions With China Over Laser Incident
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said the country would not invoke a defense treaty with the US and was aiming “to cool the tensions down” after a Chinese ship aimed a laser light at a Philippine vessel in the South China Sea.

title: Ardern, Now Sturgeon: The ‘Brutality’ of Politics Hits Women Hardest
description: There were just 30 women who were elected heads of state or government  as of September last year. Now, after the shock resignations of two world leaders, that number is dwindling further.

title: Swiss May Face a Future Referendum to Enshrine Status of Cash
Europe’s Rebel Leader Woos Germany to Profit From Arms Race
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban refused to send weapons to Ukraine after Russia’s invasion, saying he didn’t want his country to be dragged into a war. Last month, he hit out at the German government for agreeing to dispatch tanks.

title: US Calls Off Search for Two Objects Shot Down Amid Balloon Furor
description: The American military’s search for objects shot down over Alaska and Lake Huron ended without them being recovered or identified.

title: Singapore Says Man’s 2021 Death Is First Tied to Covid Vaccine
description: Singapore recorded its first fatality linked to the Covid-19 vaccine after the Ministry of Health announced that the death of a 28-year-old Bangladeshi man in 2021 was likely due to the jab.

title: Peru Congress Agrees to Talk Elections as 2023 Vote Hopes Dim
description: Peruvian lawmakers ended their legislative session on Friday by deciding to continue debates on early elections at the committee level without taking further action, dimming hopes for a vote this year.

title: ChatGPT’s Use in Condolence Email After Shooting Angers Students
description: Vanderbilt University’s Peabody College was blasted in an article by the school newspaper after administrators used ChatGPT to write a message about the importance of community after a deadly campus shooting in Michigan.
